title: LME Aluminium Cash Price Rises Amid Firm Demand and Tightening Inventories
summary: The LME aluminium cash price increased to $2,878.5 per tonne on October 27, supported by steady demand and a drop in exchange stocks. The 3-month bid price rose to $2,876.50 per tonne. Inventories fell by 3,850 tonnes to 469,275 tonnes.

title: Aluminum Hits 3-Year High Amid Supply Tightness
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high due to increasingly tight supply conditions. Major consumers are concerned about near-term tightness in physical markets, partly due to China's aluminum output cap. Aluminum futures rose to $2,815 per tonne in October.

title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory Drops in Two Regions
summary: The inventory of aluminum billet in two domestic regions decreased by 2,000 mt on October 29, 2025. This drop reflects ongoing trends in aluminum prices and inventory levels.

title: Aluminum Hits 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,899.70 per tonne on October 28, 2025, marking the highest price in over three years amid tight supply conditions. China's aluminum output cap of 45 million tons annually is set to be breached later this year, contributing to supply constraints. Additionally, operational issues at key refineries, including a suspension at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter and Alcoa's planned shutdown of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia, have pressured supply, while demand remains strong due to growth in electrification sectors.

title: Alcoa Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Alcoa reported a 4 percent sequential increase in alumina production to 2.5 million metric tons in Q3 2025, driven primarily by higher output. The company also announced plans to shut its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to deteriorating bauxite ore grades, impacting future production capacity.

title: Aluminium giant urged to back Hunter workers before shutdown
summary: Australia's largest aluminium smelter is facing a potential closure, prompting calls for the company to support its workforce, which has had a 40-year history with the facility. The shutdown reflects challenges in the aluminum production sector, including operational and market pressures.

title: Alcoa invests $60 mln in US aluminum smelter, signs 10-year energy pact
summary: Alcoa has invested $60 million in its US aluminum smelter and signed a 10-year energy agreement to support production efficiency and sustainability. This investment aims to enhance capacity and operational stability amid evolving market conditions.

title: RUSAL Deploys AI-Powered Machine Hearing and Vision Technologies to Enhance Aluminium Production Efficiency
summary: RUSAL has implemented AI-powered machine hearing and vision technologies to improve aluminum production efficiency. This technological advancement is part of the company's efforts to optimize operations and reduce costs in a competitive market.

title: From Refinery Waste to Useful Materials and Green Fuel: New Research Could Revolutionize the Global Aluminum Industry
summary: New research from the University of New Brunswick could transform the aluminum industry by making smelting more efficient and sustainable. It involves turning refinery waste into green fuel and useful materials, reducing landfill waste and supporting a sustainable future. The research aims to create a closed-loop, low-energy aluminum digestion process.

title: RUSAL Deploys AI-Powered Machine Hearing and Vision Technologies to Enhance Aluminium Production Efficiency
summary: RUSAL, a major aluminum producer, has implemented AI-powered machine hearing and vision technologies to improve production efficiency. This innovation aims to enhance operational performance and sustainability in aluminum production.

title: Steel Mill Price Adjustment
summary: Anhui Changjiang Steel has raised its guided prices for building materials, including rebar, coiled rebar, and high-speed wire, by 20 units. This adjustment reflects recent market dynamics and pricing strategies in the steel sector. The move could influence broader steel market trends.

title: Hot Rolled Coil Futures See Steady Rise
summary: Hot rolled coil futures experienced a steady rise last week, which provided some boost to the spot market sentiment. This trend could indicate improving market conditions for steel products. However, broader market trends remain mixed.

title: Algoma Steel Group Inc. to Announce 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Algoma Steel Group Inc. is set to announce its third-quarter results for 2025. This announcement could provide insights into the company's performance and the overall steel market conditions. The results may influence investor sentiment and market trends.

title: World Steel Association Releases Short Range Outlook for 2025 and 2026
summary: The World Steel Association has released its latest Short Range Outlook, projecting flat global steel demand in 2025 and a modest rebound of 1.3% in 2026. The growth in 2026 is expected to be driven by trends in developing economies and a return of growth in Europe. The outlook remains cautiously optimistic despite global uncertainties.

title: Iron Ore Price Forecast Revised Upward
summary: Goldman Sachs has revised its iron ore price forecast upward for 2026 due to a tighter market and supportive macroeconomic factors. However, the firm maintains a bearish outlook for the long term, expecting prices to decline by Q4 2026. China's steel sector is facing oversupply challenges.

title: Rare-Earth Steel Production Trends and Applications
summary: The article discusses advancements in rare-earth steel production, focusing on sustainable production methods and expanding applications in sectors like aerospace and automotive. These advancements are expected to support decarbonization efforts and infrastructure modernization.

title: 304 Stainless Steel Bolt Market Size Report 2025
summary: The global 304 Stainless Steel Bolt market is projected to grow significantly, driven by industrial development and equipment modernization. The market size is expected to increase from $448 million in 2024 to $739 million by 2031. The report analyzes market trends and competitive structures.

title: Ryerson and Olympic Steel Announce Merger Agreement
summary: Ryerson and Olympic Steel have announced a merger agreement, which will be discussed during Ryerson's third quarter 2025 earnings call. The merger involves leading processors and distributors of industrial metals, aiming to enhance market presence and operational efficiency.

title: Rare-Earth Steel Production: Guide to REE-Enhanced Alloys
summary: This article discusses advanced rare-earth steel production methods emphasizing sustainability through resource efficiency, reduced waste, and recycling programs. It highlights technological advancements such as AI-driven quality control and hydrogen materials research supporting decarbonisation in transport and industrial sectors.

title: Rare-Earth Steel Revolution: Advanced Alloys Transform
summary: The article covers environmental sustainability in rare-earth steel production, focusing on green chemistry, biotechnology, hydrogen-based metallurgy, and circular economy approaches like recycling and urban mining. It details efforts to reduce carbon emissions and improve resource utilization in steel manufacturing.

title: Addressing steel decarbonisation challenges for industry and policy
summary: This policy paper outlines the steel industry's decarbonisation efforts, noting that over 90% of steelmaking capacity is in countries committed to net-zero targets. It discusses challenges such as scaling technologies, investment needs, and market creation for low-carbon steel, emphasizing the importance of supportive policies for a sustainable transition.

title: ESTEP annual event 2025
summary: The ESTEP Annual Event 2025 gathers the European steel community to explore innovations in decarbonization, digitization, and circular solutions shaping the sustainable future of steel. The event includes presentations on Clean Steel Partnership projects and promotes cross-sector collaboration aligned with the European Green Deal.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The event where steel, technology and innovation shape its future
summary: Steel Tech 2025 is a congress and expo focusing on innovation and development in the steel sector. It features discussions on carbon-free energy sources, global raw material strategies, artificial intelligence applications, and CO2 capture and valorisation, highlighting the industry's transformation towards sustainability.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: North American Green Steel Summit 2025
summary: The North American Green Steel Summit 2025 will be held in Detroit, focusing on green steel technologies and sustainability innovations in the steel industry. The summit aims to advance discussions on decarbonisation and energy transition within North America's steel sector.

title: 3rd World Green Steel, Hydrogen and Energy Summit
summary: This summit in Dusseldorf, Germany, addresses green steel production, hydrogen technologies, and energy innovations. It serves as a platform for industry leaders to discuss sustainable steelmaking and the integration of hydrogen as a key decarbonisation tool.

title: Copper Prices Steady Amid Trade Deal Anticipation
summary: Copper prices have stabilized near record highs as markets await confirmation of a U.S.-China trade agreement. The metal is supported by tightening supply conditions and a more optimistic demand forecast. However, details of the trade deal remain vague, contributing to trader caution.

title: Copper Struggles for Clear Direction as Fed Decision, Trump-Xi Meeting Loom
summary: Copper prices were little changed as investors awaited the Federal Reserve's rate decision and a potential meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping. The metal has been supported by supply-side issues and a brighter demand outlook in Europe.

title: U.S. Government Shutdown Continues, Overnight Copper Prices First Fell Then Rose
summary: Copper prices initially fell but then rose overnight, closing higher on both the London Metal Exchange and the Shanghai Futures Exchange. The market saw improved procurement sentiment despite ongoing price pressure from buyers.

title: First Quantum Minerals Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Kansanshi mine reported copper production of 46,881 tonnes in Q3 2025, up by 6,778 tonnes from the previous quarter due to increased mill throughput from the Kansanshi S3 Expansion project. Sentinel mine produced 51,336 tonnes, an increase of 8,228 tonnes quarter-over-quarter, driven by improved ore fragmentation and crusher performance. Copper production guidance for 2025 is narrowed to 175,000 – 185,000 tonnes with expectations of higher production in Q4 2025.

title: Copper Prices Steady Amid Trade Deal Anticipation
summary: Copper prices remain stable near record highs as markets await a US-China trade agreement. Anglo American announced that production at its Collahuasi copper mine in Chile is expected to fall below previous forecasts for 2026, revising output from 470,000 tonnes to between 380,000 and 410,000 tonnes. This downgrade adds to already tight supply conditions, supporting elevated copper prices.

title: Anglo American lifts copper output amid portfolio shake-up
summary: Anglo American reported steady copper production and improved operational performance despite a temporary dip at its Collahuasi mine. The company is managing operational challenges while maintaining output levels.

title: Anglo American Faces 9% Copper Production Decline in 2025
summary: Anglo American experienced a 9% decline in copper production during the first nine months of 2025, with output falling to 526,000 tonnes. Operational challenges earlier in the year have been addressed, but sustained improvement remains uncertain. The company faces risks including equipment failures, geopolitical factors, and integration complexities following the Teck Resources merger.

title: Largest Copper Producers: Top Global Companies 2026
summary: Leading copper producers are increasingly adopting sustainable mining practices such as water recycling, renewable energy use, tailings management innovation, blockchain-based traceability, biodiversity restoration, and AI-based exploration to reduce environmental impact and meet ESG benchmarks. These innovations help the industry remain profitable and resilient amid challenges like geopolitical risks, stricter environmental regulations, and declining ore grades.

title: Gold, Silver & Copper: tech and sustainability trends
summary: Copper companies are addressing supply challenges by boosting production, adopting sustainability, and leveraging digital innovations including AI and satellite technology for exploration. Advanced mineral processing and bioleaching improve recovery rates, while recycling of copper scrap is optimized to create sustainable copper supplies, with recycled copper accounting for 32% of global supply in 2023.

title: Global Copper Demand Projected to Outpace Supply by Over 500,000 Tonnes In 2025, Driving Upward Price Pressure
summary: Copper demand continues to rise due to its critical role in infrastructure, agriculture, renewable energy, and electrification. Supply constraints, geopolitical challenges, and the need for resource resilience are driving copper prices higher. The metal is essential for smart farming, energy transmission, and electric vehicles, underscoring the importance of sustainable and innovative copper technologies.

title: A Fireside Conversation with BHP Americas President Brandon Craig
summary: This event discusses copper's critical role in the modern economy and the challenges of tightening supply, declining ore grades, and geopolitical risks. It highlights the importance of innovation and investment to secure copper supply chains and maintain technological and economic leadership, especially in the U.S. and allied countries.

title: Copper to the World 2025 highlights innovation and global partnerships
summary: The Copper to the World 2025 event showcased emerging technologies such as advanced flowsheets, in-situ recovery, and 3D modelling aimed at reducing environmental impact in copper mining. These innovations represent global efforts to improve sustainability and operational efficiency in the copper industry.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fluctuated at lows on October 29 as the US government shutdown is expected to continue
summary: On October 29, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 120,400 and 123,400 yuan/mt, averaging 121,900 yuan/mt, which was down 250 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. The price fluctuation occurred amid expectations that the US government shutdown would continue, impacting market sentiment.

title: Nickel stabilizes amid US-China trade uncertainty
summary: Nickel prices remained largely unchanged amid ongoing uncertainty in US-China trade relations. Goldman Sachs forecasted a 6% decline in nickel prices to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026, citing the need for Indonesian producer margins to shrink to curb supply growth and address the market surplus.

title: On October 29, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The LME nickel price settled at $15,320 per metric ton on Friday, marking a 1.39% week-over-week increase. Meanwhile, the most-traded SHFE nickel contract closed at 122,150 yuan/mt, also showing gains, reflecting a positive short-term trend in nickel prices.

title: First Quantum Minerals Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: First Quantum Minerals reported a 44% increase in nickel production in Q3 2025, reaching 5,767 tonnes due to higher throughput and improved recoveries. The company also lowered nickel unit cost guidance reflecting operational performance, indicating improved efficiency in nickel production.

title: First Quantum Minerals Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: First Quantum Minerals reported a 44% increase in nickel production in Q3 2025, producing 5,767 tonnes due to higher throughput and recoveries. The company narrowed its 2025 production guidance to 18,000–23,000 contained tonnes of nickel and reduced nickel unit cost guidance reflecting operational performance.

title: Nickel Intermediate Product Market Outlook for 2026
summary: Indonesia's nickel production is expected to reach about 680 kt in metal content in 2026, up over 45% year-over-year, driven by new project ramp-ups and capacity expansions. The Indonesian government’s control of ore prices and quota releases will increase costs, while demand growth is limited due to shifts in electric vehicle policies and battery material market dynamics.

title: Nickel mining threatens Raja Ampat ecosystems, communities
summary: An environmental report highlights the threat expanding nickel mining poses to Raja Ampat's coral reefs, forests, and Indigenous communities. Despite environmental concerns, the government maintained Gag Nikel’s mining permit due to compliance with environmental standards. Global automakers like Tesla and Volkswagen are linked to this supply chain through nickel supply agreements with Indonesian processors.

title: Canada G7 Critical Minerals Supply Deals Secure Chains
summary: Canada is a key player in G7 critical minerals strategy, ranking 5th globally in nickel production with 170,000-180,000 tonnes annually, mainly from the Sudbury basin. While Canada has strong nickel production, it faces processing gaps, exporting most cobalt concentrates for refining abroad. Government initiatives aim to boost domestic processing capacity for battery-grade materials.

title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low Amid Oversupply
summary: Nickel prices fell to $15,226 per tonne on October 29, 2025, pressured by oversupply from Indonesia's expanded nickel sector. Indonesia's nickel mining quotas were reduced by 120 million tons this year, cutting global supply by 35%, but markets remain oversupplied with LME nickel stockpiles rising to over 250,000 tonnes.

title: Canada G7 Critical Minerals Supply Deals Secure Chains
summary: Canada is enhancing its critical minerals supply chains through strategic partnerships with G7 countries. These partnerships focus on integrated manufacturing networks and advanced processing technologies to optimize material yields and reduce environmental impact. The initiative aims to secure premium products and competitive advantages in the critical minerals market.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary
summary: The Nickel Institute discusses sustainability and innovations in nickel production, highlighting the role of artificial intelligence in alloy development. Nickel is seen as a sustainable material throughout its value chain if all stakeholders take responsibility. The article also touches on the importance of nickel in clean energy transitions.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from enhanced energy performance and reduced environmental impact
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali signed a Memorandum of Understanding with CVA in December 2024 to enhance energy performance and reduce environmental impact in its production. The agreement supports regional decarbonisation targets and stabilizes energy sale prices, contributing to the competitiveness of the local steel sector and broader green industry conversion.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of producing green hydrogen at its plant in Aosta, Italy, using a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by powering one of its 70 furnaces entirely with green hydrogen, supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as integral to its corporate strategy and aims to continue advancing its environmental commitments.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has commenced operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a significant step in its efforts to decarbonize steel production through renewable energy technologies.
